step1.sentence: The engineering team spent the sprint trying to optimize workflow by automating repetitive code review tasks.

step2.story: After weeks of missed deadlines, the product manager called a retrospective to optimize workflow across the development team. They mapped out every bottleneck and replaced manual handoffs with automated notifications. By the next sprint, deployments that used to take a day were down to two hours.

step3.story: Lena had joined the startup as a DevOps engineer with one clear mandate: optimize workflow before the next funding round. On her first day, she shadowed each team member and filled three notebooks with friction points — unclear task ownership, redundant approval chains, and a CI pipeline that no one had touched in two years. She introduced a Kanban board, rewrote the deployment scripts, and set up automated alerts so bugs surfaced in minutes instead of days. The changes weren't glamorous, but within a month the team was shipping twice as fast with half the late-night incidents. When the investors toured the office, they noticed the calm — no firefighting, just steady progress. Lena quietly closed her notebook and smiled.

meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 업무 프로세스나 개발 파이프라인에서 불필요한 단계를 제거하고 효율을 높이는 행위를 뜻하며, 팀 생산성 향상을 논할 때 자주 사용된다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'optimize'는 라틴어 'optimus(최고의)'에서 유래했고, 'workflow'는 'work(작업)'와 'flow(흐름)'의 합성어로 일의 진행 순서를 의미한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '빠르게 하다'가 아니라 전체 과정을 분석해 구조적으로 개선한다는 뉘앙스가 강하며, 기술·비즈니스 맥락 모두에서 전문적인 어감을 준다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We need to optimize workflow so the design handoff doesn't block the developers.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 디자인 인계가 개발자들을 막지 않도록 작업 흐름을 최적화해야 합니다.
